normal_relationships: Most adults with higher education (â‰¥16) either report substantial wages or many weeks worked, while younger individuals (<16) and retirees (age >65) show wage per hour = 0 and weeks worked = 0. Capital gains, losses, and dividends are typically zero unless weeks worked > 0 or education is high. Tax filer status 4 usually coincides with zero gains. Wage per hour rarely exceeds 1000 and, if high, usually pairs with weeks worked = 52 and self-employment = 2.

anomaly_conditions.condition: wage per hour > 500 AND weeks worked in year = 0
anomaly_conditions.explanation: High hourly wage without any weeks worked suggests misreported employment data.
anomaly_conditions.scenario: Data entry error recording a lucrative wage for an individual who actually did not work that year.

anomaly_conditions.condition: age < 16 AND weeks worked in year > 0
anomaly_conditions.explanation: Minor children normally do not report full-year employment.
anomaly_conditions.scenario: Illicit child labor or misclassified age value.

anomaly_conditions.condition: capital gains > 0 AND tax filer stat = 4
anomaly_conditions.explanation: Significant investment income should not coincide with a non-filer tax status.
anomaly_conditions.scenario: Unreported investment income or miscoded tax filing category.

anomaly_conditions.explanation: Individuals without formal education rarely earn extremely high hourly wages.
anomaly_conditions.scenario: Outlier wage entry or misrecorded education level.

anomaly_conditions.condition: own business or self employed = 0 AND wage per hour = 0 AND weeks worked in year = 52
anomaly_conditions.explanation: Reporting a full work year with no pay and no self-employment contradicts normal labor patterns.
anomaly_conditions.scenario: Unpaid labor misreported as full employment or erroneous weeks-worked value.
